parameters.name: Sd
parameters.description: True for single-ended, false for doubled-ended

parameters.name: Flip
parameters.description: Flip to side cut; true if you want to remove material outside of the profile, false if not

parameters.name: Dir
parameters.description: Reverse direction; true if you want Direction 1 to be opposite of the default direction (see Remarks )

parameters.name: T1
parameters.description: Termination type for first end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: T2
parameters.description: Termination type for second end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: D1
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for first end in meters

parameters.name: D2
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for second end in meters

parameters.name: Dchk1
parameters.description: True allows draft angle in first direction, false does not allow drafting

parameters.name: Dchk2
parameters.description: True allows draft angle in second direction, false does not allow drafting

parameters.name: Ddir1
parameters.description: True for first draft angle to be inward, false to be outward

parameters.name: Ddir2
parameters.description: True for second draft angle to be inward, false be outward

parameters.name: Dang1
parameters.description: Draft angle for first end

parameters.name: Dang2
parameters.description: Draft angle for second end

parameters.name: OffsetReverse1
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the first end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: OffsetReverse2
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the second end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: TranslateSurface1
parameters.description: When you choose swEndcondOffsetFromSurface as the termination type for the first end, then true specifies that the end of the extrusion is a translation of the reference surface, false specifies to use a true offset

parameters.name: TranslateSurface2
parameters.description: When you choose swEndcondOffsetFromSurface as the termination type for the second end, then true specifies that the end of the extrusion is a translation of the reference surface, false specifies to use a true offset

parameters.name: NormalCut
parameters.description: True ensures that the cut is created normal to the sheet metal thickness, false does not (this argument applies only to sheet metal parts, use false for non-sheet metal parts)

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies or components, false if the feature affects all bodies or components

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies or components and have the feature affect those bodies or components, false to select the bodies or components the feature affects

parameters.name: AssemblyFeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the assembly feature only affects selected components in the assembly, false if the assembly feature affects all components in the assembly

parameters.name: AutoSelectComponents
parameters.description: True to auto-select all affected components, false to not (use the selected components only)

parameters.name: PropagateFeatureToParts
parameters.description: True to propagate the assembly feature to the components in the model that it affects, false to not

parameters.name: Sd

parameters.name: Flip

parameters.name: Dir

parameters.name: T1

parameters.description: Termination type for second end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: D1
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for first end in meters

parameters.name: D2
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for second end in meters

parameters.name: Dchk1
parameters.description: True allows draft angle in first direction, false does not allow drafting

parameters.name: Dchk2
parameters.description: True allows draft angle in second direction, false does not allow drafting

parameters.name: Ddir1
parameters.description: True for first draft angle to be inward, false to be outward

parameters.name: Ddir2
parameters.description: True for second draft angle to be inward, false be outward

parameters.name: Dang1
parameters.description: Draft angle for first end

parameters.name: Dang2
parameters.description: Draft angle for second end

parameters.name: OffsetReverse1
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the first end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: OffsetReverse2
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the second end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: TranslateSurface1

parameters.name: TranslateSurface2

parameters.name: NormalCut
parameters.description: True ensures that the cut is created normal to the sheet metal thickness, false does not (this argument applies only to sheet metal parts, use false for non-sheet metal parts)

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies or components, false if the feature affects all bodies or components

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies or components and have the feature affect those bodies or components, false to select the bodies or components the feature affects

parameters.name: PropagateFeatureToParts
parameters.description: True to propagate the assembly feature to the components in the model that it affects, false to not

remarks:
The default direction for cut operations are opposite the sketch normal. The default direction for boss operations is along the sketch normal. Setting the direction arguments to true reverse the default direction. For double-ended extrusions, Direction 2 is always be opposite to Direction 1.
The default sketch normal is the same as the face or plane normal where the sketch was placed. To determine this normal vector, see
IFace2::Normal
and
IRefPlane::Transform
, respectively.
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
When using cut or cavity features that result in multiple bodies, you cannot select to keep all of the resulting bodies or one or more selected bodies.
